title: Lessons from scaling Uber and Opendoor | Brian Tolkin (Head of Product at Opendoor, ex-Uber)
key_insights: Writing crystallizes thinking - Brandon figured out his frameworks while writing, not before
Platform PM work has 5-10x longer feedback cycles requiring different psychological approach
Shopify's 'help teams ship the right thing at the right time in the right way' philosophy
Focus energy on truly important decisions, go with gut on less critical ones
Remote work enhanced by intentional in-person 'bursts' for high-velocity creative work
Side hustles and technical skills crucial for PM development and credibility
Writing externally can influence internally better than internal communication
Platform PMs must define clear principles about constituent prioritization

Shopify's product culture and decision-making processes

summary: Brandon Chu shares his journey from startup founder to Shopify VP, revealing how writing crystallized his product thinking and accelerated his career. The conversation covers platform PM strategies, remote work best practices, and practical frameworks for decision-making and team leadership.
